discussion.content: I agreed with Ludwig, the order should be 3PIP, privision URL, Provision phone

I think below is the correct answer:
Update the phone to use the latest 3PIP firmware.
From the phone, configure the SIP Gateway provisioning server URL.
From the Microsoft Teams admin center provision the phone.

It seems the option "From the Microsoft Teams admin center provision the phone." comes last according to below link.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/sip-gateway-configure

At least, configuring SIP gateway provisioning server URL comes before provisioning the phone in TAC.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You have a phone that uses Microsoft Skype for Business 3PIP firmware and is connected to an on-premises Skype for Business 2019 environment.

You plan to transition from Enterprise Voice in Skype for Business Server to Microsoft Teams Phone with Calling Plan.

You need to ensure that the phone can make and receive calls by using Teams.

Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

choices.C: Create and assign a Teams Network Roaming Policy that has Video Conferencing disabled.
choices.B: Assign the Region1 users a meeting policy that has a media bit rate of 1,500 Kbs.
choices.D: Set Insert Quality of Service (QoS) markers for real-time media traffic to On.
choices.A: Assign the Region1 users a meeting policy that has Broadcast production with NDI and SDI hardware disabled.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Since they specifically mention a network site, I think C is the correct answer. Roaming policies controlling Video are assigned to Network sites. 
A - turning this off still allows for other types of A/V calls
B - this setting is per call, so 1500 is way too high.
D - QoS is assigned at the meeting policy, and doesn't relate specifically to a voice experience. This may be helpful, but doesn't control available bandwidth, just prioritization of traffic. They would be better off using the Media bit rate setting in this policy. One video call on a 1.5Mbps link could saturate the entire link. It's better to turn it off.

Selected Answer: D
To ensure that all users at the site with a 1.5-Mb connection have a good voice experience, you should set Insert Quality of Service (QoS) markers for real-time media traffic to On (Option D). QoS markers help prioritize voice traffic over other types of traffic, ensuring a better voice experience even with limited bandwidth

Selected Answer: D
D: Set Insert Quality of Service (QoS) markers for real-time media traffic to On: This ensures that Teams automatically marks real-time media traffic (voice, video, etc.) with high-priority markers on the network. This improves the chances of achieving better voice and video quality, especially when bandwidth is limited (like in your 1.5-Mb connection scenario).

questions.question_text:
You create a network region named Region1 in Microsoft Teams.

You are adding a network site to Region1. The site has a 1.5-Mb connection.

You need to ensure that all users at the site have a good voice experience.

What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
AC is correct

choices.A: Configure voice routing policies for each office.
choices.B: Configure a single voice routing policy for all users.
choices.C: Deploy a highly available Session Border Controller (SBC) pair to each office.
choices.D: Deploy one Session Border Controller (SBC) to each office. Configure the SBCs as a high-availability pair.

questions.question_text:
Your company has offices in Paris and London.
You are migrating from an on-premises PBX telephony solution to a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment that uses Direct Routing. You plan to use the existing telephony carrier. The new solution will provide telephony services to users in Both offices.
You need to recommend a solution that is the most resistant to possible failures. The solution must ensure that calls are routed through each user's respective office.
Which two actions should you include in the recommendation? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams.

You need to enable Virtual Appointments to meet the following requirements:

• Company branding must appear when participants join meetings.
• Meeting reminders must be sent to participants via SMS text messages.

Which license should you acquire, and which type of policy should you configure in the Microsoft Teams admin center? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

choices.B: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, add the MAC address of the handset.
choices.D: Connect your computer to the PC port of the handset.
choices.A: Configure the handset to use IPv6.
choices.E: Set the provisioning server URL for the handset.
choices.C: Change the handset's default administrator password to a complex password.

discussion.content: I think that E is correct according to: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/devices/sip-gateway-configure

Selected Answer: B
While E. Set the provisioning server URL for the handset is a relevant action for configuring SIP handsets, it may not directly resolve the issue of the Teams sign-in option not appearing. Here’s why option B is more appropriate:

Sign-in Requirement: For the Teams sign-in option to be available, the device must be registered and recognized within the Microsoft Teams environment. Adding the MAC address in the Microsoft Teams admin center links the handset to the Teams account, enabling sign-in functionality.

Provisioning Server URL: Setting the provisioning server URL is important for directing the handset to the correct configuration settings, but if the device isn’t registered or recognized by Teams, simply configuring the provisioning server won't trigger the Teams sign-in option. The device needs to be added to Teams first for it to retrieve the appropriate configuration and display the sign-in option.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams Phone.

You are reconfiguring a SIP handset to use SIP Gateway.

You discover that the Teams sign-in option fails to appear on the handset.

You need to ensure that the Teams sign-in option appears on the handset.

What should you do?
